Detailed Description

Stochastic Simulation Algorithm (SSA).

This class is a subclass of class BaseSystem. This class provides function which uses SSA to simulate reaction systems. It uses the Mersenne Twister method to generate uniform random number in the range of (0, 1)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Create a system with zero species.

end_time a double argument, set the end time of the system, default to be zero.

Member Function Documentation

int SSA::NextStep_Direct ( double  end_time  ) 

Use Direct Method to update the system.

If the advance of the step passes over the end_time, then don't do the step, and return -1, otherwise return 0. The current time and the state vector will remain the status after the most recent reaction.

int SSA::NextStep_MultiScale ( EquilibriumFunction  equilibrium,
double  end_time 
)

Use MultiScale SSA to update the system one step.

If the advance of the step passes over the end_time, then don't do the step, and return -1, otherwise return 0.

Parameters:
equilibrium a function to update the state vector provided by user.

void SSA::SimulateDirect ( double  start_time,
double  end_time,
double  time_interval,
bool  rxncount = false,
vector< int > *  output_species = NULL 
)

simulate the system from start_time to end_time, output every other time_interval.

output reaction counts if the rxncount parameter is set to be true.

Parameters:
output_species pointer to vector holding indices of targeted species, only species's in this vector are output default to be NULL to output all species' counts

vector< int > &  rxn_indices,

simulate the system from start_time to end_time, output whenever any reaction in the reaction list happens

output reaction counts if the last parameter is set to be true.

void SSA::EnsembleSimulation ( double  start_time,
double  end_time,
int  n,
bool  rxncount = false,
vector< int > *  output_species = NULL 
)

Ensemble simulation of n times.

By default output only the species counts after each simulation. By default the reaction counts of each reaction is not output. By default all the species' counts will be output. output reaction counts if the last parameter is set to be true.

Parameters:
output_species pointer to vector holding indices of targeted species, only species's in this vector are output default to be NULL to output all species' counts.

void SSA::EnsembleStatisticsSimulation ( double  start_time,
double  end_time,
double  time_interval,
int  n 
)

Ensemble simulation of n times, compute the statistics result of each time point.

This method will compute the statistics for all the interested time points given by user over all n simulation of a single system. The statistics includes the mean and standard deviation for all species at those time points.

double SSA::StepSize_Direct ( double  propensity_sum  )  [protected]

Compute the time interval for the next reaction.

This is the implementation for the direct step size.

Parameters:
propensity_sum a double argument, the sum of all reaction's propensity

int SSA::NextRxn_Direct ( double  a0,
StochVector &  a 
) [protected]

brief Compute the next reaction index.

This method generate an integer random variable j with point probabilities a[j]/a0

a the vector which is holding the data

double SSA::TransformWithinZeroOne ( Integer  random_int  )  [private]

Transfer an uniform random integer to a real number in the range of (0,1).

The result real number will be in the open range of (0, 1), not including 0 and 1.

Parameters:
random_int an integer argument, follow a uniform random distribution
